parameters.definition: Total acres of available land for hay processing
Hay processed by the windrower per acre
Hay processed by the hay harvester per acre
Methane gas produced by the windrower per acre
Fuel required by the windrower per acre
Methane gas produced by the hay harvester per acre
Fuel required by the hay harvester per acre

description: A farmer has \(\param{TotalAcres}\) acres of land on which he must process hay using either a windrower or hay harvester. For each acre of land, the windrower can process \(\param{HayWindrower}\) kg of hay while the hay harvester can process \(\param{HayHarvester}\) kg of hay. Per acre, the windrower produces \(\param{MethaneWindrower}\) kg of methane gas and requires \(\param{FuelWindrower}\) kg of fuel. On the other hand, the hay harvester produces \(\param{MethaneHarvester}\) kg of methane gas per acre and requires \(\param{FuelHarvester}\) kg of fuel. There are \(\param{TotalFuel}\) kg of fuel available and the farmer can produce at most \(\param{MaxMethane}\) kg of methane gas. For how many acres should each machine be used to maximize the amount of hay processed?
